intro: Aldama tuberculata, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy. Aldama tuberculata is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
